com.orbitz.monitoring.api.template
Interface TransactionMonitorCallback

public interface TransactionMonitorCallback

The TransactionMonitorTemplate will build a transaction monitor and pass it to the doInMonitor(com.orbitz.monitoring.api.monitor.TransactionMonitor) callback method.

Generally, TransactionMonitorCallback implementors do not even need to use the monitor passed to them.

Callback implementors do not need to make calls to TransactionMonitor.succeeded() or TransactionMonitor.done()

The TransactionMonitorCallback does not attempt to handle checked exceptions. Any RuntimeException thrown will be handled with a call to TransactionMonitor.failedDueTo(Throwable)

Method Summary
 java.lang.Object doInMonitor(TransactionMonitor monitor)
          Execute logic within a try/catch/finally block using the given TransactionMonitor.
 

Method Detail

doInMonitor

java.lang.Object doInMonitor(TransactionMonitor monitor)
Execute logic within a try/catch/finally block using the given TransactionMonitor. Note that the monitor given has already been declared as TransactionMonitor.succeeded(). If you wish to declare the monitor a failure either call TransactionMonitor.failed(), TransactionMonitor.failedDueTo(Throwable), or throw a RuntimeException

Parameters:
monitor - TransactionMonitor to use
Returns:
anything you wish to be returned from the template
